src:
Milojevićevih 100 pobeda iz drugačije ugla: Ljudi, život nam zavisi od jednog slobodnjaka! (VIDEO)
Zanimljiv osvrt Miloša Kosanovića i objašnjenje zašto je Jang Bojs značajniji od Salcburga

06 Nov 2019

Trener Crvene zvezde Vladan Milojević je nedavno proslavio 100. pobedu na klupi srpskog šampiona. Bio je to povod da ekipa Zvezda TV snimi prilog o putu koji je iskusni stručnjak prošao na Marakani zajedno sa članovima stručnog štaba.
Zna se da je Milojević Crvenoj zvezdi doneo dve šampionske titule, Ligu Evrope, proleće u Evropi, dve Lige šampiona, trijumf nad Liverpulom. Ali on nema dilemu kada se oetio najsrećnijim.„Kada sam došao da budem trener moje Crvene zvezde. Ne možete da planirate u životu, ali hteo sam da bar jednu utakmicu sednem na klupu crveno-belih. Tada sam bio najsrećniji. Ostalo je da radite, i verujete ono što radite“, poručio je Vladan Milojević u razgovoru sa Tatjanom Šajković.



Zanimljiv osvrt na pređen put imao je jedan od glavnih Milojevićevih saradnika, Milan Kosanović. Kao i uvek, rođeni Novosađanin je bio direktan.„Imponuje to što smo prevazišli takvu veličinu kao što je Branko Stanković. Rekord Miljana Miljanića je za sada netaknut, ali videćemo u budućnosti.Najteže je bilo protiv Krasnofdara, to je bio početak velike ere. Posebno 92. minut kada je dosuđen slobodan udarac. Izvodio ga je Pereira, igrač koji je poznat po golovima iz prekida. Sa tim golom bi ispali. Na stadionu je bilo 60 hiljada ljudi. Na klupi se Milojević okreće i kaže nam: „Ceo život nam staje u jedan slobodan udarac“. Desilo se da je Pereira promašio, i već sledeće godine stigli smo do famoznog Salcburga“, prisetio se Kosanović.



Međutim, on smatra da je veći uspeh napravljen leta.„Nekako mi je draži uspeh protiv Jang Bojsa. Kada smo ušli prvi put svi su govorili da je slučajno. A onda dolazimo u situaciju da ulazimo drugi put. Nijedan srpski trener to nije uradio. Sale Stanojević je jednom ušao, Mateus je Nemac. Ovde se ta činjenica provlači kroz medije, ali se ne saopštava. Taj zadatak će biti ostavljen budućim pokolenjima“.
text:
Milojevic's 100 Wins from a Different Angle: People, our life depends on one freelancer! (VIDEO)
An interesting review by Milos Kosanovic and an explanation of why Young Boys is more important than Salzburg

06 Nov 2019

Red Star coach Vladan Milojevic recently celebrated his 100th victory on the Serbian Champion's bench. This was the reason for the Zvezda TV crew to record a story about a trip that an experienced expert has traveled to Marakana with members of the expert staff.
It is known that Milojevic brought two titles to the Red Star, the Europa League, spring in Europe, two Champions League, triumph over Liverpool. But he has no dilemma when he finds himself happiest. "When I came to coach my Red Star. You can't plan for life, but I wanted to sit at least one game on a bench of red and white. I was happiest then. The rest is to do, and believe what you do, "said Vladan Milojevic in an interview with Tatjana Sajkovic.



One of Milojevic's main associates, Milan Kosanovic, had an interesting comment on the road trip. As always, the native Novosadjanin was direct. "It is impressive that we have exceeded such a size as Branko Stankovic. Miljan Miljanic's record is intact for now, but we'll see in the future. The hardest thing was against Krasnofdar, it was the beginning of a great era. Especially the 92nd minute when a free kick was awarded. It was performed by Pereira, a player known for scoring goals. With that goal they would drop. There were 60,000 people in the stadium. On the bench, Milojevic turns around and tells us: "Our whole life is a free kick." It happened that Pereira missed, and next year we reached the famous Salzburg, "Kosanovic recalled.



However, he believes more success was made in the summer. "I kind of prefer success against Young Boys. When we first came in everyone was saying it was random. And then we come into the situation of entering another time. No Serbian coach did that. Sale Stanojevic once came in, Mateus is German. This is where the fact goes through the media, but it is not communicated. That task will be left to future generations. "
